li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-menu-item page_item page-item-10845 current_page_item
li.a:
COVID-19
Georgia Chamber of Commerce's central repository for all COVID-19 related information.

article.class: fl-post post-10845 page type-page status-publish hentry

span.p: The Georgia Chamber is encouraging businesses and communities to make fact-based decisions and stay informed on COVID-19. We will continually update this page with information and resources pertaining to the Coronavirus.
Follow us on social media for real-time updates.

li.h3: Upcoming Virtual Conference – Ft. Georgia Attorney General Chris Carr
li.p: UPCOMING VIRTUAL CONFERENCE FOR TUESDAY – April 21, 2020 @ 10:00AM ESTfeaturing Georgia Attorney General Chris CarrOur next call is scheduled for Tuesday, April 21, 2020 at 10:00AM EST and...

div.p: As leaders begin discussions about reopening the economy, we know that it does not signal an end to the pandemic nor an abatement of the financial crisis for which we all face an inevitably long and rather costly recession. It is instead a call for the business community to engage and the government to prepare and consider additional action at the local, state and federal levels.

div.p: DISCLAIMER: The Georgia Chamber seeks to provide access to recommendations, regulations, services and expertise to its members. During the COVID-19 pandemic, this mission remains constant. Prior to acting, members should consult their own professional advisors for information and counsel specific to the individual and unique situations faced by organizations, individuals and corporations. The opinions, interpretations and recommendations of the Georgia Chamber are informational only and should not be relied upon by the recipient as legal or professional advice.
